name: Input Map
description:
Input map

Use the Input map during the design-to-developer handoff to organize all input information. The file contains a table with different variants allowing you to communicate information about any input to the developer, such as restrictions, default values, labels, and more. It can be used to communicate information for different components such as input components, selects, drop-downs, sliders, or any other input you wish to communicate to the developer.

About me:

I specialized in developing digital products for different software companies, focusing on user experience, user interface, design systems, research, and usability tests.

I regularly work closely with developers, product managers, and QA teams.


In addition to that, I am a moderator of design thinking workshops and mentor new designers who want to enter the UX field or improve their UX skills.
